text: An abolitionist is, as I have developed that notion, one who (1) maintains that we cannot justify animal use, however humane it may be; (2) rejects welfare campaigns that seek more humane exploitation, or single-issue campaigns that seek to portray one form of animal exploitation as morally worse than other forms of animal exploitation (e.g., a campaign that seeks to distinguish fur from wool or leather); and (3) regards veganism, or the complete rejection of the consumption or use of any animal products, as a moral baseline. An abolitionist regards creative, nonviolent vegan education as the primary form of activism, because she understands that the paradigm will not shift until we address demand and educate people to stop thinking of animals as things we eat, wear, or use as our resources.
author: GaryLFrancione

text: The rights paradigm, which, as I interpret it, morally requires the abolition of animal exploitation and requires veganism as a matter of fundamental justice, is radically different from the welfarist paradigm, which, in theory focuses on reducing suffering, and, in reality, focuses on tidying up animal exploitation at its economically inefficient edges. In science, those who subscribe to one paradigm are often unable to understand and engage those who subscribe to another paradigm precisely because the theoretical language that they use is not compatible.
Some instances in life call for humility. But, sometimes you need to be flat-out brazen when it comes to the desires of your heart.

text: There is a higher form of hierarchy and that is the hierarchy of the spirit. When I stand in front of a person, I stand in front of a soul and I have met magnificent souls in bodies possessing no money, as well as parched and shallow souls in bodies bathed in riches. In the same light, I have met magnificent souls in bodies bathed in wealth, as well as parched and shallow souls in bodies that are impoverished. I am tired of people busying their minds with hierarchy based upon money, because this form of hierarchy is primitive; meanwhile there is an altogether higher form of hierarchy that is of the soul. As you judge man and woman based upon their riches, I laugh at your primitive form of judgment! When I stand in front of a human, I stand in front of a soul.
author: C. JoyBell C.

text: Maybe God doesn't care if we get all dressed up and sit in the pew every Sunday, as Diana believes. Instead, maybe God comes to us through men like Sloth, watching over us as we make our own decisions. Maybe God has always been with me. Opening doors, leading me to opportunities, letting me choose my own path, and loving me even when I chose the wrong one. Never giving up on me. Knowing all along that I am on a journey. That I must find my own way to Him. Maybe River was rights. Maybe God does still believe in me.

text: My friends, don't idolize hardship. What you idolize is what your heart will look for and what your heart looks for is what you will have. And don't capitalize on misfortune, because you will always seek out to have capital! Throw away that pride! Don't put sorrow on a pedestal! If you ask me if I would rather have had my sorrows or not, I will tell you that no, I would rather have not had any of them! In the blink of an eye, I would rid myself of them! I have no pride. I don't rely on hardships and sorrows to mold me into someone. I don't allow myself to be dictated. When hardship and sorrow come knocking, saying "We are responsible for who you are today, let us in!" I'm going to say, in a split second, "No you're not! Go away, I don't owe you anything!
author: C. JoyBell C.

text: In a few more days I'd anticipated telling Veronika that our injections had cured her heart condition. But in light of her unscheduled departure form Villette my telling that particular lie will not be required. The majority of people who attempt suicide repeat that attempt until they succeed. I took a risk in lying to her about her condition, i decided to test the only remedy i have come to have any faith in: awareness of life. Until she finds out from some other doctor that she is perfectly healthy. She'll consider each day a miracle. Which in my view it is.
author: Paulo Coelho, Veronika Decides to Die

text: During the crash and burn, I began to burn from cranial crown to flat sole, for meaning and understanding. Every concept, psychological perceptions with hardened pathways, everything that registered as inherited from the communal was starting to dissolve into meaninglessness. The foundational tenets, the pre-established belief systems, instilled sustenance systems tended by both family and extended communal began to dissolve, first as trivial, and then as untenable to my being without validation from me. If my life was worth anything, I choose to live the best life for me.
author: So I entered what I call The Blank State.

text: Prince Wen-hui's cook, Ting, was cutting up an ox. Every touch of his hand, every ripple of his shoulders, every step of his feet, every thrust of his knees, every cut of his knife, was in perfect harmony, like the dance of the Mulberry Grove, like the chords of the Lynx Head music. Well done! said the prince. How did you gain such skill? Putting down his knife, Ting said, I follow the Tao, Your Highness, which goes beyond all skills. When I first began cutting up oxen, all I could see was the ox. After three years, I had learned to look beyond the ox. Nowadays I see with my whole being, not with my eyes. I sense the natural lines, and my knife slides through by itself, never touching a joint, much less a bone. A good cook changes knives once a year: he cuts. An ordinary cook changes knives once a month: he hacks. This knife of mine has lasted for nineteen years; it has cut up thousands of oxen, but its blade is as sharp as if it were new. Between the joints there are spaces, and the blade has no thickness. Having no thickness, it slips right through; there's more than enough room for it. And when I come to a difficult part, I slow down, I focus my attention, I barely move, the knife finds its way, until suddenly the flesh falls apart on its own. I stand there and let the joy of the work fill me. Then I wipe the blade clean and put it away. Bravo! cried the prince. From the words of this cook, I have learned how to live my life.
author: Stephen Mitchell , The Second Book of the Tao

text: What if man is not really a scoundrel, man in general, I mean, the whole race of mankind-then all the rest is prejudice, simply artificial terrors and there are no barriers and it's all as it should be.
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky, Crime and Punishment

text: Because... he used to cradle his daughter in his arms every morning and often they would exchange soft nuances ...if you can dream it, if you can see it in your visions at night, if you can feel it in your soul, it's yours! And it never really belonged to anyone else, in the first place! It was always yours! Viera returned her scroll to the drawer and closed it, she kissed the compass around her neck and climbed into her bed under the warm quilts, the candle flame crackled and the memories of her father's arms around her embraced her there in bed and his deep, hoarse voice resounded in her ears; ... and if you chance upon a treasure that is yours and it happens to be in the possession of someone else, it's not very wrong to take what is yours, to take what you dreamed, what you saw in your visions at night, what you felt visit you in your spirit! Sure, it's not lawful, but aye aye my little one, listen to me when I tell you that the best things in life are not under the laws of any sort! For which law created love? Which law created courage? The best things, the real things, are the things that are not measured by any man's laws! Fear is the only thing that any law has ever created! And what kind of pirates would we all be if we were afraid of any of our fears, even a little!
author: C. JoyBell C.

text: Denying yourself a life of personal freedom is denying yourself of a life worth living.
author: Michelle D. Rosado

text: I am going to open myself up to all that is superior in the world and beyond and I am going to spend time trying to take delight in things! Not finding ruin in them! If the ruin of you is what you look for, the ruin of you is what you are going to find!

text: Edine meje v tvojem življenju so tiste, ki si jih postaviš sam.

text: If you have put your faith in Christ and have spent significant time in the Word of God, the tough times can be like a magnet that draws you to the Lord Jesus. He is able to help His children work through anything, and not a single thing is going to happen in the future that can change that fact.

Even if you make it go to goose church and goose school and eat goose feeds and only hang out with geese! In the end, it will still belong to paradise.

text: We can remove the veil that shrouds our understanding and made us forget who we truly are. We are not our religion. We are not our sexual preference. We are human beings. We are spiritual beings.

text: The Buddha encouraged people to "know for yourselves that certain things are unwholesome and wrong. And when you do, then give them up. And when you know for yourselves that certain things are wholesome and good, then accept them and follow them."
When all is said and done all anyone has left is their integrity at their core... Don't give that away too.

text: He won't listen to the music, and I can't turn it off.

text: In-existence, the soul's greatest imposition is its perfection. It is projected as a perfected form of the physical embodiment, an emblem of things, perhaps hyperreal and untouchably perfect as existence. It can not be! The soul in-existence is nothing of perfection. It is raw potential. The soul is nothing but potential. To be specific, the soul is unordered potential!
author: dew platt, The Rudeness of Soul

text: Remember that a wish held fervently turns into belief, and a belief held diligently becomes reality.

text: We've all received our share of good fortune, so that's my definition of much. A single blessing is all the bounty in the world, and if you've been blessed at all you're meant to pass some of that on. You're meant to set a positive example. That's our responsibility" (20) - Denzel Washington, "So that We Might Follow
author: Denzel Washington, A Hand to Guide Me

text: Worth as I use it here is immeasurable, not as in mathematics towards infinity. But that it can not be measured. There are no measurable parameters for it! Certainly not a material-communal measurable parameter for it! Such, it is what the being holds that cannot and should never be traded. When it is there, every essence of your being knows it, and takes commands from it that will be able to override any personal or imposed sense of value.
author: Dew Platt, Failure&solitude

text: A dream is an idea involving a sense of possibilities rather than probabilities, of potential rather than limits. A dream is the wellspring of passion, giving us direction and pointing us to lofty heights. It is an expression of optimism, hope and values lofty enough to capture the imagination and engage the spirit. Dreams grab us and move us. They are capable of lifting us to new heights and overcoming self-imposed limitations.
author: Robert Kriegel

text: The Yorubas have a saying, here, my translation in English--a poor fool is a bigger fool rich. In other words, money only allows and enables you to be more of who you are. My bigger translation? You don't jump essence, you jump environs!
author: Dew Platt

text: Jesus knew that many of his listeners believed the old wineskin (or way of doing things) was good enough. They were comfortable with their beliefs and practices, but Jesus hadn't come to patch up old religious traditions. He was offering a new garment, a new wineskin, a way of life that didn't abolish the old ways, but fulfilled them.
The day we put an end to believing in hope will be the day we stop existing, for without hope, we are nothing.
author: K.M. Parr, The Clairvoyance Clock

text: Be the Light you seek so desperately in your life and chase away that darkness.

text: Go where your nose leads you

text: Say you are at the brink of killing yourself and someone tries to talk you out of it. You've already thought about it and your life is not worth living. Someone else comes along and tries to convince you not to kill yourself. Is there someone out there that can convince you not to kill yourself? What can they possibly say to convince you that your life, the one you have firsthand knowledge of, is worth living? There is that one answer. No one! There is that other answer. Nothing!
author: Dew Platt, Failure&solitude

text: The mandarins of culture—what do they do to teach the common folk to read? It's no good writing down lists of books for farmers and compiling five-foot shelves; you've got to go out and visit the people yourself—take the books to them, talk to the teachers and bully the editors of country newspapers and farm magazines and tell the children stories—and then little by little you begin to get good books circulating in the veins of the nation. It's a great work, mind you!
author: Moley, Christopher

text: I used to fear things like not having enough alcohol and drugs, or the money to get them. Now I fear someone holding me down and physically forcing me to take drugs and drink alcohol. I fear that for some reason I wouldn't be allowed or wouldn't be able to read anymore.

text: Tonight I saw Jesus with the eyes on my face. He looks half lion and half man. But not more like a lion and not more like a man, rather the same, I have never seen anything like the face of Jesus before, %100 one thing but %100 another thing: a lion man! Where did you see Him at? On the surface of my blanket as I lay in bed. He was suddenly drawn onto it, like a sketch, and that same moment I knew He was showing His face to me, finally. Why do you think He did that? I think He thought it was about time.

text: When every car is moving to the fast lane. The fast lane becomes slow. That is what happens to you too. When you are doing , what everyone else is doing. When everyone is doing the same thing. When people are trying to recreate the event or moment that was good. It delays your progress and success, but if you stick to your own lane. You might get to your destination which is progress and success in time.

text: Whatever fear he'd instilled in people on the streets was of no consequence inside the market, packed with ramshackle stalls and vendors and food stands, smoke drifting throughout, the tang of blood and spark of magic acrid in his nostrils. And above it all, against the far wall of the enormous space, was a towering mosaic, the tiles taken from an ancient temple in Pangera, restored and re-created here in loving detail, despite its gruesome depiction: cloaked and hooded death, the skeleton's face grinning out from the cowl, a scythe in one hand and an hourglass in the other. Above its head, words had been crafted in the Republic's most ancient language:
author: Memento Mori.

text: Some people build custom motorcycles, cars, and knives. I build custom lives.

text: In reality, we do not believe in reality, we believe in the illusion of reality.

text: Most depressed people don't believe that, they can be happy, but they choose to believe that every happy person, can be depressed. So, they made it their goal or task to make it so. To make everyone as depressed as they are. Misery loves company. Choose not to allow people to make you depressed as they are. Always choose happiness.

text: Self-talk should be a conversation of priority with oneself. It can be encouraging when having a positive outlook on life with your thoughts, beliefs, and ideas. text: Traveling is an escape from the norm. It's a suitcase full of surprises and new adventures. It's an adjustment to new time zones and new cultures. It's a refreshing treat that makes you see things clearer. Smell better. Taste better. Traveling opens new doors and sometimes closes old ones. It makes you begin to either value what you have back home or realize that
author: maybe life is better lived somewhere else, sometimes even with someone else,

text: Deep down inside, you know what your passion is, your calling, your purpose in life. It's whatever you're excited about when you wake up every morning, no matter how silly or superficial it seems. It gives you energy. It fills you with joy. You lose track of time when you're doing it. Dream big. You are important. Your dreams are important. Your life's purpose is important.

text: You don't need to know how you will succeed; you just take one step at a time to put yourself on the right path to success.

text: Visualization, belief, and taking action are fundamental to achieving your purpose.

text: Write out your ideal schedule as if you are doing what you love, so you visualize exactly how your day will go. Find times and ways to do whatever activities you can that actively pursue your purpose. Set calendar or phone alerts to help you stay on track. Looking back, it will surprise you at how quickly your ideal schedule became your reality.
author: Mina Faraway, The Key to the Secret: 15 Fast and Easy Steps to Achieving What You Want Now

text: Pretend, through your thoughts and feelings, you are doing the activities you love. Revel in the excitement.
author: Mina Faraway, The Key to the Secret: 15 Fast and Easy Steps to Achieving What You Want Now

text: Think about the things you do now that are not along the lines of your purpose in life, and come up with a substitute action or thought about your passion you can imagine doing instead that brings you joy and fulfills you.
author: Mina Faraway, The Key to the Secret: 15 Fast and Easy Steps to Achieving What You Want Now

text: Visualize the next day before you go to sleep at night and when you wake up the next day. This solidifies the schedule you've created filled with activities that fulfill your passion and purpose.
author: Mina Faraway, The Key to the Secret: 15 Fast and Easy Steps to Achieving What You Want Now

text: Practice letting go of the needing, wanting, or lacking feelings. Those feelings draw you back into the reality of not having what you want. Stay focused on having and the joy it brings you.
author: Mina Faraway, The Key to the Secret: 15 Fast and Easy Steps to Achieving What You Want Now

text: Keep to your schedule as closely as possible to stay focused on convincing yourself you have everything you desire now.
author: Mina Faraway, The Key to the Secret: 15 Fast and Easy Steps to Achieving What You Want Now

text: When you pay your bills, visualize the money circulating to and from you. Know that the money you pay for the goods and services you need is also supporting the people, things, and businesses you use. Your job is to keep it circulating, so it goes out and comes back in larger amounts.
author: Mina Faraway, The Key to the Secret: 15 Fast and Easy Steps to Achieving What You Want Now

text: As you pay your bills, pretend you're donating the money to the charities and organizations that mean the most to you and make you happy. Include any tithing or businesses you want to support that help solve local or world problems. Revel in how happy and grateful it makes you feel to help make the world a better place.
author: Mina Faraway, The Key to the Secret: 15 Fast and Easy Steps to Achieving What You Want Now

text: Do you see my diamond-studded smile and passion-filled eyes? It's because I'm in that stage of my life where I have nothing to prove to anyone. There is no elaborate pretence and no lavish ostentations. Genuineness smoulders in yellow gold, and I carry integrity on my eyelids. I stitch virtue, ornately and intricately, in every feather of my powder silver wings, which thrusts me past the iridescent rainbow where my ambitions soar high amid the dappled blanket of the sky. This is I; the stronger me, the happier me and the empowered me.

text: your journey will scare some people. the steps that you take will intimidate others, and the paths that you take will confuse some. people are afraid of things they can't control, and when they realize that they have no power over you, it scares them. it brings out their biggest fears, it unmasks their deepest insecurities, it reveals their true colors. when you live in your truth and it goes against what other people believe in, you're always going to rub some people the
author: wrong way. they'll have opinions, they'll have ideas, they'll have assumptions, but what they think of you is none of your business.

text: empathy can be your best friend or your biggest enemy. there will be several situations in life that will bring you to a crossroad. a crossroad between what's good for you and what's good for them. understand that there is absolutely nothing wrong with being selfish and doing what's best for you. some people won't understand your decisions initially, and some may never understand at all, but your peace of mind and happiness are not worth sacrificing for anything or anyone. you've worked too hard on yourself to be affected by people and things that don't understand the energy and time you've put into yourself.

text: Don't just listen to what the person says; watch what they do. Because what people say is one thing, but what they do reveals the truth about them.
author: Tony Robbins

text: Silence is useless where injustice exists. We must ask ourselves, if I am silent on this matter what consequences must I live with for my role in knowing and not speaking out.
author: Daisy Gallagher

text: Damn son, where'd you find this?
author: Socrates

text: One of the most profound things you can do to achieve peace in this life is to love yourself, by being yourself.
author: Jodi Livon

text: I love the art of reading, when we are drowned by other people's stories and attempt to swim deep into all the chapters.
author: Shaa Zainol

text: Every flower reflects hope for the future and renews my aspirations for what the world can be.
author: Rita A. Gordon, Give Thanks and Smell the Flowers: A Gratitude Journal

text: Great things can happen at any time.
author: Rita A. Gordon, Grateful: A Gratitude Journal

text: A pesar de que poseemos el libre albedrío, el destino absoluto es inmutable. Lo que se supone que debe ocurrir siempre ocurre, de una manera u otra.
author: J.R. Ward, Lover Enshrined

text: Es mucho mejor no tener ningún interés que sentirse insatisfecha. La insatisfacción crea un vacío que pesa demasiado.
author: J.R. Ward, Lover Mine

text: La tragedia, como el amor, hace que la gente se vuelva ciega.
author: J.R. Ward, Lover Reborn

text: Cuando eres esencialmente infeliz, estar con la persona que amas no es suficiente.
author: J.R. Ward, The King

text: Don't think there is no door you can't walk through.
author: It takes a reasonable amount of effort to succeed in life.

text: You may be the last thread of hope keeping someone alive.
author: Always be compassionate, you never know whose life depend on the choices you make.

text: Don't think there is no door you can't walk through. It takes a reasonable amount of effort to succeed in life.
author: With the right effort you can walk through all doors.

text: As long you choose, to have excuses for your failure. You will never win.
author: As long you choose ,to blame someone for your mistakes and wrong actions.

text: Trust me for free because no one sells trust
author: Kyemwa sudyce icemab

text: Don't ever declare anything as an ultimate, even everything has its own kind of macrocosm; it's the only game of involvement, which results the nature of acquirement.
author: Malik Mehrose

text: Aquel que permite que el miedo lo gobierne, convierte al miedo en su amo.
author: Sherrilyn Kenyon, Night Embrace

text: La verdad no nos hace libres. En ocasiones, nos esclaviza.
author: Sherrilyn Kenyon, Kiss of the Night

text: El preludio de la caída es el orgullo.
author: Sherrilyn Kenyon, Seize the Night

text: Hasta el diablo puede llorar si echa un vistazo por el infierno y se da cuenta de que está solo
author: Sherrilyn Kenyon, Devil May Cry

text: La gente juzga muy pronto a los demás sin conocerlos. Juzgan su presente y su pasado, pero muchas veces las sonrisas esconden un gran dolor. Lo que la gente muestra al mundo solo es una minúscula parte del iceberg que se oculta a la vista. Y es mucho más probable que ese iceberg esté lleno de grietas y cicatrices que surjan de lo más hondo del alma.
author: Sherrilyn Kenyon, Acheron

text: No dejes que el ayer consuma demasiado del presente.
author: Sherrilyn Kenyon, Retribution

text: Dicen que el camino al infierno está cuajado de buenas intenciones.
author: Sherrilyn Kenyon, Retribution

text: Arrogancia, esa es la primera causa de muerte tanto entre los reyes como entre los vasallos. Cuídate de su afilada hoja. Suele herir a la persona que la empuña más que a los demás.
author: Sherrilyn Kenyon, Retribution

text: Todas las personas tienen un pasado. Cosas que se les clavan en el corazón. Antiguas rencillas. Antiguas humillaciones. Remordimientos que les roban el sueño y los dejan despiertos hasta que temen por su cordura. Traiciones que hacen que sus almas griten con tanta fuerzan que se preguntan cómo nadie más las es escucha. Al final, todos estamos solos en nuestros infiernos personales. Pero la vida no consiste en aprender a perdonar a quienes te han hecho daño ni olvidar el pasado. Consiste en aprender a perdonarte a ti mismo por ser humano y por cometer errores. Sí, la gente nos decepciona a todas horas. Pero las lecciones más duras nos llegan por decepcionarnos a nosotros mismos. Cuando depositamos nuestra confianza y nuestros corazones en las manos de la persona equivocada y nos hace daño. Y aunque podemos odiarlos por lo que nos hicieron, más nos odiamos a nosotros mismos por haber dejado entrar a esa persona en nuestro círculo privado.
author: Sherrilyn Kenyon, Time Untime

text: Todas las personas tienen un pasado. Cosas que se les clavan en el corazón. Antiguas rencillas. Antiguas humillaciones. Remordimientos que les roban el sueño y los dejan despiertos hasta que temen por su cordura. Traiciones que hacen que sus almas griten con tanta fuerzan que se preguntan cómo nadie más las escucha. Al final, todos estamos solos en nuestros infiernos personales. Pero la vida no consiste en aprender a perdonar a quienes te han hecho daño ni olvidar el pasado. Consiste en aprender a perdonarte a ti mismo por ser humano y por cometer errores. Sí, la gente nos decepciona a todas horas. Pero las lecciones más duras nos llegan por decepcionarnos a nosotros mismos. Cuando depositamos nuestra confianza y nuestros corazones en las manos de la persona equivocada y nos hace daño. Y aunque podemos odiarlos por lo que nos hicieron, más nos odiamos a nosotros mismos por haber dejado entrar a esa persona en nuestro círculo privado.
author: Sherrilyn Kenyon, Time Untime

text: Margaret Mead dijo en una ocasión que una de las necesidades humanas más antiguas es tener a alguien que se pregunte si vas a volver a casa por la noche.
author: Sherrilyn Kenyon, Time Untime

text: Traicióname una vez y tú serás el culpable. Hazlo dos veces y el culpable seré yo.
author: Sherrilyn Kenyon, Son of No One

text: Tal vez la vida consistiera en eso. No en conseguir lo que se desea, aquello que uno pensaba que podría hacerlo feliz. Sino en encontrar lo que se necesita de verdad, a esas maravillosas personas sin las cuales es imposible vivir.
author: Sherrilyn Kenyon, Dragonmark

text: Traición. Cruda y brutal, siempre se presentaba con la forma del amigo y aliado más cercano. La herida que provocaba en el alma era tan profunda que la víctima, desangrada y débil, se preguntaba si alguna vez sería capaz de confiar en alguien de nuevo.
author: Sherrilyn Kenyon, Dragonsworn

text: A man without self control is prone to destruction. Your control management will determine the pattern your life will take. If you cannot control yourself, you will give and attract negative energy.
author: Ojingiri Hannah

text: Maintain a relationship with those who support you at all times. Because when your times are bad, even a small child gives you advice. That's why my dear friends, I want to tell you that keep a relationship with the one who not only gives you advice in your bad times but also supports you..
author: Mr. Nitin Jain

text: The things man do publicly, women do secretly. The things women do secretly . Man do publicly. When it comes to moral compass . We are all the same.
author: De philosopher DJ Kyos

text: People who are not intelligent or with the lowest IQ , always reason by insults , fight or violence.
author: De philosopher DJ Kyos

text: People will mock you, make fun of you and laugh at you. When you take a decision that makes you stronger and the decision that benefits you, because they want you to doubt yourself and revert the decision you made. After seeing that you are becoming strong, then they will start to hate you and recruit others in hating you.
author: De philosopher DJ Kyos

text: There is always going to be a reason to get irritated by people's behaviour but if you find a reason not to, then you are one step closer to tranquility.
author: Ojingiri Hannah

text: Isn't life beautiful? We don't have time to complain about anything. If you like it, keep doing it; otherwise take another path.
author: Mwanandeke Kindembo

text: Everyone thinks and imagines that life is easier on the other side. Their minds swing like a pendulum.
author: Mwanandeke Kindembo

text: I wish & pray that the latter part of this year be greater than the former & you experience the breakthrough you have been waiting for.
always do your things now cause postponing for other time never ends!!!
author: LIDIYA HABTAMU

text: You can only understand the uselessness of money if you find yourself in a desert with a handful of a bag of money. You will starve to death.
author: Mwanandeke Kindembo

text: God can give you anything, but not make you immune to temptation and be patient in life. This is where freedom of choice, free will, comes into play.
author: Mwanandeke Kindembo

text: Without women there is no party and celebration. This is when all the fun begins. They are partying animals by nature.
author: Mwanandeke Kindembo

text: The size of a storm is determined by the "size" of the person in the storm. What a tadpole may consider to be stormy waters may not be so for a whale.
author: Yaw Frimpong Tenkorang

text: Some people do not want you to grow and succeed because they like looking down on you. As long as their life was better than yours they felt good about themselves, it made them feel superior. However, all that changes once you know your worth and being to understand your greatness. They feel threatened and will do and say anything to keep you down which is why you need to be careful of the advice you receive.
author: Sope Agbelusi

text: Some people do not want you to grow and succeed because they like looking down on you. As long as their life was better than yours they felt good about themselves, it made them feel superior. However, all that changes once you being to know your worth and understand your greatness. They feel threatened and will do and say anything to keep you down which is why you need to be careful of the advice you receive.
author: Sope Agbelusi

text: Even though a "YES" sounds better sometimes a "NO" is more important.
author: Sope Agbelusi

text: The foolishness of man is that he tends to become what others want of him and he takes great pride in being different from who he really is.
author: Shiva Negi

text: Es posible que hoy sea un día malo, pero mañana puede convertirse en el mejor de tu vida. Solo tienes que llegar a él.
author: Mia Sheridan, Grayson's Vow

text: A veces, ni siquiera te das cuenta de que algo no te conviene hasta que llega alguien y te cambia, te hace querer ser más.
author: Mia Sheridan, Stinger

text: La felicidad es agradable, sí, pero también es... fugaz. Y se basa en lo que se tiene o no en un momento dado. La felicidad... tiene que ser alimentada continuamente. No llena de propósito la vida. No da sentido a la existencia.
author: Mia Sheridan, Preston's Honor

text: A veces, los viajes que hacemos en la vida parecen tardar una eternidad en llegar al punto culminante de nuestros esfuerzos, en alcanzar nuestro objetivo. Y una vez que lo hacemos, pasa tan deprisa que termina antes de darnos cuenta. Nos olvidamos de que el viaje es la mejor parte. La razón por la que salimos. Dónde más aprendemos.
author: K. Bromberg, Driven

text: No te pierdas a ti misma por intentar conservar a alguien a quien no le importa perderte.
author: K. Bromberg, Fueled

text: Porque el bagaje de una persona es algo muy poderoso. Puede contenerte. Impedirte que sigas adelante. Matarte. Y, a veces, los sentimientos no bastan para deshacerte de él. Para que avances con tu vida.
author: K. Bromberg, Crashed

text: Puedes intentar orientar tu vida en una determinada dirección todo lo que quieras, pero, en última instancia, es el viento quien hincha las velas.
author: Claire Contreras, Kaleidoscope Hearts

text: Love yourself and you will be rewarded.
author: Shaa Zainol

text: You can become what your passion wants you to be, show your greatness, and others will follow.
author: Jesus Apolinaris

text: If you only knew how many battles I became
author: victorious in the presence of GOD, you will not

text: Son las elecciones que hacemos las que determinan quiénes somos.
author: Anna Zaires, Titan's Addiction

text: No se va a ver a las personas o a los animales cuando sabes que tienen las horas contadas, se les va a ver cuando crees que tienen su reloj lleno de minutos y de horas, y lo haces porque les quieres y porque deseas pasar su tiempo con ellos.
author: Ana Forner, Miles de emociones con tu nombre

text: Las personas que viven su vida desde el lado del victimismo prefieren ser eso, víctimas, porque es mucho más fácil culpar a los demás de sus fracasos antes de reconocer sus propios errores o limitaciones.
author: Ana Forner, Miles de emociones con tu nombre

text: Las lágrimas son sólo el recordatorio de que algo no funciona como debería, pero también son algo más: son la forma que tiene el corazón de expresar lo que siente.
author: Ana Forner, Miles de emociones con tu nombre

text: Eso es lo malo del tiempo: solo fluye en una dirección.
author: Joanna Wylde, Silver Bastard

text: Lo peor de perder a alguien que uno ama es el hecho de que también te pierdes a ti mismo.
author: Brittainy C. Cherry, The Air He Breathes

text: Vale la pena tener el corazón roto por esos momentos de felicidad. Y los pedazos de un corazón se pueden volver a juntar. Quedarán cicatrices, claro, y alguna herida, y a veces los recuerdos del pasado llegan a quemar, pero eso quiere decir que has sobrevivido al incendio. Ese dolor marca tu renacer.
author: Brittainy C. Cherry, The Air He Breathes

text: A fin de cuentas tu hogar no está en un sitio concreto, sino en una sensación que te proporcionan las personas que más te importan, una sensación que calma las llamas de tu alma.
author: Brittainy C. Cherry, The Fire Between High & Lo

text: Life is a book you can learn more.
author: Ambika Thapa

text: Nothing is easy, different things hit by different energy. Embrace whatever life brings for you and make peace with it.
author: Shaa Zainol

text: You will only look for past events when the present is unsatisfactory. The secret to enjoying the present moment is to make it more satisfying than the past. Go beyond the limits.
author: Mwanandeke Kindembo

text: In the middle of the road, I found my father
author: Father was not a biological father but a true father

text: Protest to have a parent
author: A parent will eventually show up to you

text: Thanks to God the true parent of all times
author: Times to know and to have faith in God

text: I consider my mother as a real parent
author: Parent who knows when she becomes a mother or a father

text: My father knows how to reward me and my siblings
author: Siblings have different interests and hobbies

text: Disabilities mean nothing if you have a loving parent
author: Parent of a child with a disability must have love

text: I have tried to conceive without any successes
author: Successes have not knocked on my door for a long time

text: Tips for a great parent are three. Love, learn and pray
author: Pray that God protects your children and their children

text: With too many children an organized schedule is needed
author: Needed to have a private time with each child

text: Mother Nurture is Mother Nature.
author: Reed Abbitt Moore, Piggy Sense!: Save It for a Rainy Day

text: Writing is art.... it reflects a creative process of experimentation and self-expression.
author: Ray McGinnis, Writing the Sacred: A Psalm-Inspired Path to Appreciating and Writing Sacred Poetry

text: We all have a destiny and the goal is to find it in all endeavours to attain fulfilment in life.
author: Shiva Negi

text: Only repetition with a goal in mind can truly lead to mastery. Sometimes you can keep rehearsing without learning anything new.
author: Mwanandeke Kindembo

text: All knowledge is only accumulations of previous generations. I don't think an individual deserves all the praise for knowing something beautiful.
author: Mwanandeke Kindembo

text: I denounced the body and the mind. Still, that doesn't mean I should refrain from feeding the beast.
author: Mwanandeke Kindembo

text: Who are the best sinners between corporeal and spiritual beings?
author: Mwanandeke Kindembo

text: In the process of finding the true 'I' you have to become formless and infinite as the Supreme One. Become one with the universe.
author: Mwanandeke Kindembo

text: Murderer: What, you egg?
The relationship between the brain and the body is similar to that of a master and a slave. There is a lack of effective communication.
author: Mwanandeke Kindembo

text: With the concept of reincarnation, being offered more chances to repent, we will eventually destroy the idea of heaven and hell.
author: Mwanandeke Kindembo

text: According to the ideology of reincarnation, Earth is both your heaven and your hell. Everything is paid for and rewarded here.
author: Mwanandeke Kindembo

text: If you fail in your leadership, then blame yourself. God has nothing to do with you leading other souls under your own feet.
author: Mwanandeke Kindembo

text: Consciously or unconsciously, we are the authors of our stories and far too often we waste our day telling ourselves the same story that caused worry or stress the day before. We don't have to do this
author: Elle Sommer, THE POWER OF CONSCIOUSNESS: A GUIDE TO MANIFESTING A BRILLIANT LIFE

text: When you shift your stories, you shift your world. Maybe not making things suddenly appear like magic, but certainly making them change where you begin to flow more readily with the naturally positive energies of the universe. In this place, you are capable of anything. Of great things. And amazing, brilliant things can open up to you, and for you, on a more consistently reliable basis.
author: Elle Sommer, THE POWER OF CONSCIOUSNESS: A GUIDE TO MANIFESTING A BRILLIANT LIFE

text: You can imagine or pretend to know your partner, but you will still be surprised at the end of the day.
author: Mwanandeke Kindembo

text: Mastering time is similar to an individual who's trying to predict the direction in which the wind will blow.
author: Mwanandeke Kindembo

text: Change the cause, and you change the effect.
author: Joseph Murphy

text: I am more than what others want of me. I am more than what society expects of me. I will not let my life be defined by a box meant to hold me down.
author: The Thoughtful Beast

text: You deserve the best, so stop accepting less!
author: DrB!

text: Don't waste your time trying to fix others. Fix yourself!
author: DrB!

text: If you want to be accepted as you are, learn to accept others as they are.
author: DrB!

text: Do something to them who cannot repay you in cash or kind"TM
author: Durvesh Sharma, Paralyzed Life: Do Something to Them Who Cannot Repay You in Cash or Kind'' TM

text: Dont waste time criticizing the choices of others, instead learn from their choices and apply that knowledge to your journey.
author: Dembe Michael

text: مَن مِنَّا الذي ينقر في بدن الآخر؟
author: أنا أم أنتْ؟

text: Don't wait for things. Don't wait for sunny days. Get your umbrella out and go play in the puddles.
author: Dedra Davis

text: If you simply exist in life, your life will cease to exist.
author: Dedra Davis

text: Dreams don't have deadlines. Dreams don't have wrinkles!
author: Dedra Davis

text: Love is a choice. You can choose to love or hurt but the consequences you suffer will always be based on the choice you make. No one can force you to choose between the two but the state of your heart, mind and soul will determine the one you lean toward. Always remember that with hurt you can destroy but with love you can CONQUER!
author: Kemi Sogunle, On Becoming Restored

text: Do Good and Be Good
author: Even Though

text: The fear of failure, lead us to fail, even thou we are capable of making it.
author: De philosopher DJ Kyos

text: Happiness, love, contentment, peace, fulfillment and freedom will be attained only after self-knowledge in the realization of God; The very source of everything we experience is within us that which needs nothing from the outside world but needs to realize the true nature of the self. There is nothing outside that can satiate the hunger of your soul.
author: Shiva N

text: I can go to sleep hungry every night. But I cannot ever give up my struggle to achieve my dreams!
author: Avijeet Das

text: we are lost without sincerity
author: kkshaw47

text: A true successful life is not measured by goals achieved or things possessed; but it is a life that is always at peace with God and with everyone in all circumstances.
author: Bruce Mbanzabugabo

text: Porque la mentira edulcorada era preferible a la verdad desgarradora.
author: L.J. Shen, The Kiss Thief

text: Al fin y al cabo, solo había una cosa peor que perder a un familiar cercano a quien amabas debido a una muerte inesperada: perder su amor y su cariño mientras seguías con vida.
author: L.J. Shen, The Kiss Thief

text: Don't try to change me.
author: Love, Embrace all sides of my imperfection, and Inspire me to become the greatest version of myself.

text: Don't expect to emotionally receive what you refuse to emotionally give
author: Dr. Ikoghene S. Aashikpelokhai

text: Silence isn't empty
author: Prashanth Chakkula, The Other Side of Silence: The Hidden Strength

text: Generous spirits always strive to shine brightly and won't fade away. Let's rise & keep glowing.
author: Shaa Zainol

text: Yo PUEDO pero no TENGO que hacerlo todo.
author: Michelle Dominguez Zorzano, X Una Razón: Si no me crees, sigue leyendo;)

text: When you really want something, the universe always conspires in your favor
author: Paulo Coelho, The Alchemist

text: Learn to choose quality of life over standard of living.
author: Vicki Robin, Your Money or Your Life

text: God has created Adam and Eve to be our parents
author: Parents are the source of love and happiness

text: The first thousand pictures were taken by my parents
author: Parents were involved in the majority of the pictures

text: My mother thought that it was enough to have me only
author: Only one child means only one angel

text: My mom was gone the same day I have arrived
author: Arrived in the world and lived with one parent

text: Be honest and you will be successful
author: Successful people are not all honest

text: When your heart beats know that you are alive
author: Alive is all of us but not all of us are ready for success

text: I love you
author: You are who you are because I am in love with you

text: Who do you meet makes a little difference?
author: Difference between you and you

text: I do not feel better
author: Better days are to come for those who never give up

text: Replace your worries with luxuries
author: Luxuries do not have to cost you a lot

text: On a scale of 1-10, how strong are you?
author: You are strong to show the world that you can

text: Start early to finish early
author: Early is better than later

text: True wisdom consists only in the knowledge of the Soul.
author: Shiva Negi

text: What's needed isn't change; it is transformation. Change seeks different solutions to intractable problems. Transformation asks different questions so that we can see the problems in a new light.
author: Vicki Robin, Your Money or Your Life

text: हर कोई पैदा होता है लेकिन हर कोई मरता नहीं है।
author: Shiva Negi

text: If you only do what you can do, you can never be more than what you are now.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Not everyone can see a tree within
author: a seed.

text: Once a week and it is all of us
author: All of us get together, joke, laugh, chill, and yell

text: If you succeed honor your parents first for your success
author: Success was accomplished and completed because of their support

text: Time exists. Do not take it for granted
author: Granted for many reasons and none of them is to waste

text: Not because they love you they can see the ambitions in you
author: You are not supposed to get upset if they do not

text: One jet has all of us for the first time
author: Time to reap what I have labored for many years

text: Eight million dollars I have
author: I have an empty pocket but eight children

text: For this week we wait from a year to another
author: Another year we have to wait to come back here again

text: Celebrate others great moments and be happy for their success
author: Success takes turns and will knock on your door or window

text: Catch your breath and do not rush
author: Rush to be on time and before time

text: Ears and eyes are the avenues of data and information
author: Information is absorbed and never used carefully

text: A special character belongs to you
author: You and everyone has his special character

text: The network is necessary for business
author: Business is the art of gaining more customers than profits

text: Those who are willing to die will live, those who to try to spare their own lives will die.
author: Yi Sun-sin

text: May You Remain Stable knowing past, present, future all at once. Unshakeable as the Witness of this Drama. The Trustee Solid and Free.
author: DodeeJi

text: Your passion is the love you feel in your heart for something worth pursuing, bringing wealth and success with endless happiness that will always inspire others to follow their dreams.
author: Jesus Apolinaris

text: Unleash all that is there in you, and live to your full potential.
author: Sripa Vimukthi

text: Success is iterative for me; ideas into action, constant refinements until I achieve the outcome.
author: Sripa Vimukthi

text: OTHERS BECAUSE OF MONEY ARE BRANDS, YOUR NATURE AND PERSONALITY SHOULD BE BRAND.
author: SACHIN RAMDAS BHARATIYA

text: PEOPLE FRIGHTEN ONLY THOSE WHO ARE AFRAID, SHOW COURAGE AND NOT ONLY EVIL, EVEN THE BRAVE WILL BOW THEIR HEADS.
author: SACHIN RAMDAS BHARATIYA

text: BE GOOD TO PEOPLE IN YOUR OWN EYES, PEOPLE ARE PEOPLE, THEY DO NOT HESITATE TO FIND FAULTS IN GOD TOO.
author: SACHIN RAMDAS BHARATIYA

text: Be it before you be it.
author: Chris Morgan (SON)

text: My shadow tells me there is light behind.
author: Nazia Syed

text: No matter what life throws at you, declare you will never surrender until you rise up from it.
author: Hiral Nagda

text: Choose a job you love and you'll never have to work a day in your life
author: Confusius

text: The important thing about a problem is not the solution, but the strength we gain in finding a solution
author: Seneca

text: If you don't prioritise your life, someone else will
author: Greg McKeown, Essentialism The Disciplined Pursuit of Less, Deep Work, So Good They Cant Ignore You 3 Books Collection Set

text: Act boldly, time is limited
author: Jim Lawless

text: All I want is all I can see,
author: All i can see in front of me

text: Having a high level of belief in what you can do and the devotion to doing it is a powerful combination for getting exactly what you want.
author: Jennifer Crowley, Ever Wish You Got Hit by a Truck?: A Woman's Manual for Bravely Changing Lanes at Any Age

text: Leaning on others is not a sign of weakness. You are honoring their love for you by accepting it and making them feel needed and loved in return.
author: Jennifer Crowley, Ever Wish You Got Hit by a Truck?: A Woman's Manual for Bravely Changing Lanes at Any Age

text: Don't wait for someone or something to come and change your life. The power of change, along with the responsibility to carry it through, resides in you.
author: Jennifer Crowley, Ever Wish You Got Hit by a Truck?: A Woman's Manual for Bravely Changing Lanes at Any Age

text: Now is the right time for you to be and do what you've always wanted. Imagine getting out of bed each day with newfound energy because you're living your authentic life.
author: Jennifer Crowley, Ever Wish You Got Hit by a Truck?: A Woman's Manual for Bravely Changing Lanes at Any Age

text: Nothing is as personally powerful as summoning your strength to make changes and then doing the hard work to get there.
author: Jennifer Crowley, Ever Wish You Got Hit by a Truck?: A Woman's Manual for Bravely Changing Lanes at Any Age

text: Twin Flames are the united creative energies of masculine & feminine. They are the energetic flow of total unconditional love.
author: Lala Agni, I JUST WANT YOU TO REMEMBER: A Story About The Eternal Love Of Twin Flames And So Much More

text: Love gives the mind freedom to be creative, and creativity is the intelligence used to create beautiful things from the heart.
author: Jesus Apolinaris, Rebecca Jones

text: The sense of freedom you feel of being love can bring many endless positive affirmations forming a beautiful mind. Positive thinking and self-empowerment is a factor in the circle of love. What a fantastic sense of freedom love creates in your heart, bringing extraordinary creativity for a better life. However, we must never forget that without love, we have nothing.
author: Jesus Apolinaris

text: Over the years I have developed and employed a variety of such coping mechanisms, mostly focusing around a philosophy I call, Live Because.

Learn as much as you can. Part of this learning will be your art, learning all aspects of your craft in depth and always challenging the boundaries of your style and comfort zone. But also study the world, literature, philosophy, politics, science—all the things that combine to form life as we know it. Because art is the portrayal of life, and the more you learn, the more you will have to call upon and be inspired by. Finally, don't be afraid to market yourself. No one else will do it for you. Know what you're capable of, and do not rest until others see it, too.

text: Try not to live a life of hypocrisy; if you do, you will meet the same fate for the same behavior or actions; you had criticized others. Hypocrisy is unavoidable because it is part of the human race, but we don't need to embrace it. We all have imperfections and weaknesses; we must do our best to offer support instead of being hypocritical.
author: Jesus Apolinaris

text: Hypocrisy is a form of self-deception and self-ignorance while engaging in the same behavior or activity for which one criticizes another—allowing one to maintain the illusion that they are better than others.
author: Jesus Apolinaris

text: Learn to walk away from people who just want your presents , but not your presence.

Applying the knowledge from past experiences before making decisions can save you from distress. Always make sure there is no conflict with your wisdom and your heart's desires before deciding on the matter.
author: Jesus Apolinaris

text: Pieces of my self
author: Debatrayee Banerjee, A Whispering Leaf. . .

text: Pieces of my self.
author: I have come to realise that our soul is not a static element or something that we can ever put in words. It is something that we find and embrace in bits and pieces flowing through an endless journey of life. Sometimes we find a halo of it in the setting sun while sometimes we chase its harmony in a distant sunrise. We have moments in Life, defining our traits, when some incident or some part of our Life changes forever rather takes shape forever but that too is not entirely rigid, they too flow with our soul and may be years or even moments later they change shape into something that twinkles more with our soul. It is a process of learning, unlearning and relearning where everything that we assemble in this Lifetime is like a free flowing river which meanders its way onto an ocean. And the ocean is Love. Not the Love that we often imagine it be, it is something beyond any imagination or definition. It is an air that absorbs every other force of Nature and releases them through the filter of Wisdom. It is about understanding our innermost fear and fighting it out with the indomitable courage that is always lurking in the deepest part of our heart. It is about knowing how contagious kindness can be and becoming the reflector of grace through our very existence. It is about embracing every chapter of our life with gratitude for the path that our spirit has chosen beyond boundaries and limits. It is about growing and healing. Growing through a voyage that is endless in this Cosmic ocean and healing through the balm of connections. I have realised that every connection that we make even if it is for a fraction of a second stays on within our soul and every alley that we explore leads us to a place that is closer to our destination. Sometimes the Destination gets blurred through the noises of all that is tangible in our surroundings and we often grow exhausted on this journey, it is then that we grow, trying to walk over a pyre of our failures, lost bonds, detours and everything that are capable of pulling us down they become stars, like the fireflies that show us the path to bring us closer to our soul, to put back the pieces of our self. They make us all that we stand as a whole. So especially when we run out of our strength somewhere in some hidden alley of our soul, something burns in our soul, a flicker of our passion guiding us home, where the pieces of our soul dance in a mad harmony to awaken the flame that lights our way onto a destination, wandering along the edge of a purpose that breathes through scattered pieces of our self, basking in the halo of eternity.

text: I realized that despite society's molds, we had choices. We, and only we, could decide the course of our lives. There would always be obstacles. text: Sometimes our success is blocked by the people that we're with. We need to evaluate the role of each individual in our lives.
author: Mitta Xinindlu

text: Love Every Moment of your LIFE without regrets; YOU ARE AMAZING & BEAUTIFUL, ENJOY LIFE WITH LOVE, LAUGHTER, & SMILES.
author: Jesus Apolinaris

text: Not all pain is harmful. Some forms of pain are valuable lessons.
author: Mitta Xinindlu

text: Some valuable lessons are disguised as an inconvenience. Don't miss out on them.
author: Mitta Xinindlu

text: Sometimes you don't need to change yourself to succeed. You just need to remove some people from your life.
author: Mitta Xinindlu

text: They don't understand you because you use a different equation to get to the answer. An equation that they're not accustomed to. It's not you. It's them.
author: Mitta Xinindlu

text: Perhaps not today, and possibly not tomorrow. All I know is that when my time comes, I'll get what I wished for because I'm strong enough to fight for it.
author: Shaa Zainol

text: You were rightly destined for our family, Catherine. Almost by instinct you seem to have stumbled on the old tradition by which the châtelaines of Montsalvy would go to Puy, in times of war and danger, to implore divine help and offer their most beautiful jewels to the Madonna. Go, my daughter, you think as a true Montsalvy would!
author: Juliette Benzoni, Catherine and Arnaud

text: Not all trees bear green leaves yet in their diversity, they are all beneficial because of their oxygen and more. We may also differ but this shouldn't be a reason to not be beneficial to each other.
author: Bruce Mbanzabugabo

text: If you have someone in your life who makes you feel loved and cared and inspires you then you are truly blessed!
author: Avijeet Das

text: Choose someone who makes you feel serene and contented. Someone who understands you and your feelings. Someone who makes you feel calm. Someone who connects with you deeply and soulfully. Someone who knows you like they know their own soul!
author: Avijeet Das

text: Some nights are made for making you remember that you are not alone in this world, the sky, stars & the moon are there with you to make you realise that you are born to do something special in this lifetime & for that you just need to find it.
author: Urvashi Vats

text: We gain freedom when we refrain ourselves from the fact what people will say.
author: Urvashi Vats

text: It matters not what someone is born, but what they grow to be.
author: Jk Rowling

text: Never develop an ego after achieving success.
author: Chetan Maheshwari

text: Nothing focuses a writer on writing quite like knowing the yard needs mowing.
author: Garon Whited

text: Wake up with determination. Go to bed with satisfaction
author: Unkown Author

text: Energy wasted on the past doesn't produce much for the future. Sam, Blackhorse Road A Novel
author: Merida Johns, Blackhorse Road: A novel of deception and forgiveness and love gained and lost

text: The scar is gone, but the cut will never be forgotten.
author: Huguens Noel, 180 Degrees of Consciousness

text: Iwanan mo na ang lungkot at lumbay, Mabuhay ng masaya, at huwag sumabay sa agos ng problema.
author: Napz Cherub Pellazo

text: Focus only on your dreams, visions, and take all competition out of the equation
author: Rhonda Byrne, The Secret

text: Have you noticed when you get impractical and let yourself get dreamy and playful, wonderful things happen? It's like stepping off your path and finding a hidden meadow of sunflowers.
author: Jeanne McElvaney, Old Maggie's Spirit Whispers

text: Love is not long suffering.
author: Kierra C.T. Banks

text: The breath is a small daily reminder of the cyclic nature of life. We are constantly inhaling and exhaling in our lives. We take in information and let it go. We rise like the breath and we also fall. Sometimes we feel full and sometimes we are empty.
author: Jenny C. Bell, In the Cave of my Heart: Poems

text: Learn to love what you have now and take care of it.
author: Napz Cherub Pellazo

text: Never believe that a few caring people can't change the world. For indeed, that's all who ever have.
author: Margaret Mead, Written by Herself: Autobiographies of American Women: An Anthology

text: Our introduction is one of the most important conversations to have, so make it with honesty. Trust depends on honesty; without honesty, there will be no trust. If trust exists from dishonesty, it will be destroyed.
author: Jesus Apolinaris

text: ✿´´¯`•.¸¸. ི♥ We invite a new reality when we're ready to live differently•¸.•♥•.¸¸.•♥ •¸..•*¨*•
author: Jeanne McElvaney, Ignite Changes Using Energy: A Guide for Letting Go of Old Thinking

text: Where there is darkness there is light, and where there is light, darkness cannot hide
author: Josephine Smith-Mands

text: Some of our 'bad' friends smile and laugh with us. Then, they go behind our back and laugh at us ...with their 'good' friends.
author: Mitta Xinindlu

text: Many people mistake laughter for happiness. Yet, some people laugh when they're angry, under pressure, or mad.
author: Mitta Xinindlu

text: Yes, we learn from adults. But we get the purest lessons from our toddlers.
author: Mitta Xinindlu

text: If we believe that our happiness depends on something we don't currently have, then we cant be happy here and now. Yet here and now is the only time we can be happy. We cant be happy in future; it doesn't yet exist.
author: David Michie

text: Death is not the end, it's the beginning of a new life.
author: Don't be afraid to die, be willing to embrace a new start.

text: Es solo un día, una simple jornada diaria, pero son los pequeños momentos los que más significan, los que dan forma al tejido de nuestras vidas.
author: Ilsa Madden-Mills, Spider

text: Nothing happens by accident and always by design.
author: Kierra C.T. Banks

text: Remember that in the end, those who laughed the hardest did not prove to be the happiest.
author: Mitta Xinindlu

text: There is a beautiful paradox between laughter and tears. I wish that you'll laugh until your tears flood your face. All because you're truly happy.
author: Mitta Xinindlu

text: Recognise the type of laughter that you receive. Some people laugh when they're intensely irritated. Not necessarily because they find you amusing.
author: Mitta Xinindlu

text: Laugh often. But also laugh genuinely.
author: Mitta Xinindlu

text: Not everyone who laughs with you is on your side. Some do it to make you a prey to their evil plans.
author: Mitta Xinindlu

text: When people say they laugh often together, it could indicate an easy feeling between the connection of their energies. Or it could also indicate that there are no serious issues to discuss.
author: Mitta Xinindlu

text: Laughter is not an indication of happiness.
author: Mitta Xinindlu

text: Share your jokes with people who will understand, not with people whom you're trying to impress.
author: Mitta Xinindlu
